member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI
member.summary: The WinAPI class exposes Windows API's used by controls and made available to other assemblies.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysEnableWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function enables or disables mouse and keyboard input to the specified window or control. When input is disabled, the window does not receive input such as mouse clicks and key presses. When input is enabled, the window receives all input.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window to be enabled or disabled.
[in] Boolean that specifies whether to enable or disable the window. If this parameter is TRUE, the window is enabled. If the parameter is FALSE, the window is disabled.
member.returns: Nonzero indicates that the window was previously disabled. Zero indicates that the window was not previously disabled. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysFindWindow(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This function retrieves the handle to the top-level window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. This function does not search child windows.
member.param: [in] Long pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the class name or is an atom that identifies the class-name string.
[in] Long pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the window name (the window's title). If this parameter is NULL, all window names match.
member.returns: A handle to the window that has the specified class name and window name indicates success. NULL indicates failure. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysGetAsyncKeyState(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function determines whether a key is up or down at the time the function is called, and whether the key was pressed after a previous call to GetAsyncKeyState.
member.param: [in] Specifies one of 256 possible virtual-key codes.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value specifies whether the key was pressed since the last call to GetAsyncKeyState, and whether the key is currently up or down. If the most significant bit is set, the key is down. The least significant bit is not valid in Windows Embedded CE, and should be ignored. GetAsyncKeyState returns the current key state even if a window in another thread or process currently has the keyboard focus.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysGetClassName(System.IntPtr,System.Char[],System.Int32)
member.summary: The GetClassName function retrieves the name of the class to which the specified window belongs.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.
[out] Pointer to the buffer that is to receive the class name string.
[in] Specifies the length, in TCHAR, of the buffer pointed to by the lpClassName parameter. The class name string is truncated if it is longer than the buffer and is always null-terminated.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysGetForegroundWindow
member.summary: This function returns the handle to the foreground window; the window with which the user is currently working.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysGetKeyState(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function retrieves the status of the specified virtual key. The status specifies whether the key is up, down, or toggled on or off; alternating each time the key is pressed.
member.param: [in] Specifies a virtual key. If the desired virtual key is a letter or digit (A through Z, a through z, or 0 through 9), nVirtKey must be set to the ASCII value of that character. For other keys, it must be a virtual-key code.
member.returns: If the high-order bit is 1, the key is down; otherwise, it is up. If the low-order bit is 1, the key is toggled. A key, such as the CAPS LOCK key, is toggled if it is turned on. The key is off and untoggled if the low-order bit is 0. A toggle key's indicator light (if any) on the keyboard will be on when the key is toggled, and off when the key is untoggled.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysGetLastError
member.summary: Retrieves the calling thread's last-error code value. The last-error code is maintained on a per-thread basis. Multiple threads do not overwrite each other's last-error code.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysGetWindow(System.IntPtr,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.GetWindowType)
member.summary: The GetWindow function retrieves a handle to a window that has the specified relationship (Z-Order or owner) to the specified window.
member.param: [in] Handle to a window. The window handle retrieved is relative to this window, based on the value of the uCmd parameter.
[in] Specifies the relationship between the specified window and the window whose handle is to be retrieved.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a window handle. If no window exists with the specified relationship to the specified window, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysGetWindowText(System.IntPtr,System.Char[],System.Int32)
member.summary: This function copies the text of the specified window's title bar, if it has one, into a buffer.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window or control containing the text.
[out] Long pointer to the buffer that will receive the text.
[in] Specifies the maximum number of characters to copy to the buffer, including the NULL character. If the text exceeds this limit, it is truncated.
member.returns: The length, in characters, of the copied string, not including the terminating null character, indicates success. Zero indicates that the window has no title bar or text, if the title bar is empty, or if the window or control handle is invalid. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysKeyboardEvent(System.Byte,System.Byte,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.KeyFlags,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function synthesizes a keystroke. The system can use such a synthesized keystroke to generate a WM_KEYUP or WM_KEYDOWN message.
member.param: [in] Specifies a virtual-key code. The code must be a value in the range 1 to 254.
[in] Specifies a hardware scan code for the key.
[in] Specifies an additional 32-bit value associated with the keystroke.
[in] Specifies an additional 32-bit value associated with the keystroke.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysRegisterHotKey(System.IntPtr,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.HotkeyID,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.HotkeyModify,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function defines a system-wide hot key.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window that will receive WM_HOTKEY messages generated by the hot key. The value of this parameter should not be NULL.

[in] Identifier of the hot key. No other hot key in the calling thread should have the same identifier. An application must specify a value in the range 0x0000 through 0xBFFF. A shared dynamic-link library (DLL) must specify a value in the range 0xC000 through 0xFFFF.
[in] Specifies keys that must be pressed in combination with the key specified by the nVirtKey parameter in order to generate a WM_HOTKEY message.
[in] Specifies the virtual-key code of the hot key.
member.returns: Nonzero indicates success. Zero indicates failure. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysSetForegroundWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SetForegroundWindow function puts the thread that created the specified window into the foreground and activates the window. Keyboard input is directed to the window, and various visual cues are changed for the user. The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that created the foreground window than it does to other threads.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window that should be activated and brought to the foreground.
member.returns: If the window was brought to the foreground, the return value is nonzero. If the window was not brought to the foreground, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysShowWindow(System.IntPtr,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WindowType)
member.summary: This function sets the specified window's show state.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window.
[in] Specifies how the window is to be shown. The first time ShowWindow is called, the value should be the value obtained by the WinMain function in its nCmdShow parameter.
member.returns: Nonzero indicates that the window was previously visible. Zero indicates that the window was previously hidden.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysSystemParametersInfoW(HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery,System.Int32,System.Char[],HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WinInit)
member.summary: This function queries or sets system-wide parameters, and updates the user profile during the process.
member.param: [in] Specifies the system-wide parameter to query or set.

[in] Depends on the system parameter being queried or set. For more information about system-wide parameters, see the uiAction parameter. If not otherwise indicated, you must specify zero for this parameter.

[out] Depends on the system parameter being queried or set. For more information about system-wide parameters, see the uiAction parameter. If not otherwise indicated, you must specify NULL for this parameter.

[in] Boolean that, if a system parameter is being set, specifies whether the user profile is to be updated, and if so, whether the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message is to be broadcast to all top-level windows to notify them of the change.
member.returns: Nonzero indicates success. Zero indicates failure. This function will return ERROR_RESOURCE_DISABLED if you attempt to set the values SPI_SETBATTERYIDLETIMEOUT, SPI_SETEXTERNALIDLETIMEOUT, or SPI_SETWAKEUPIDLETIMEOUT when GWES suspend management is disabled. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysUnregisterHotKey(System.IntPtr,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.HotkeyID)
member.summary: This function frees a hot key previously registered by the calling thread.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window associated with the hot key to be freed. This parameter should be NULL if the hot key is not associated with a window.
[in] Identifier of the hot key to be freed.
member.returns: Nonzero indicates success. Zero indicates failure. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysCreateFileW(System.String,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.AccessType,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.ShareMode,System.IntPtr,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.CreateType,HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.FileAttributes,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This function creates, opens, or truncates a file, COM port, device, service, or console.
member.param: [in] Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the object, such as file, COM port, disk device, or console, to create or open.
[in] Type of access to the object. An application can obtain read-only access, write-only access, read/write access, or device query access.
[in] Share mode for object. If dwShareMode is zero, the object cannot be shared. Subsequent open operations on the object will fail, until the handle is closed.
[in] Ignored; set to NULL.
[in] Action to take on files that exist, and which action to take when files do not exist.
[in] File attributes and flags for the file.
[in] Ignored; as a result, CreateFile does not copy the extended attributes to the new file.
member.returns: An open handle to the specified file indicates success. If the specified file exists before the function call and dwCreationDisposition is CREATE_ALWAYS or OPEN_ALWAYS, a call to GetLastError returns ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS, even though the function has succeeded. If the file does not exist before the call, GetLastError returns zero. INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE indicates failure. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysEventModify(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.param: [in] A handle to the event object.
State to change too. 2 = Reset, 3 = Set
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SetEvent(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sets the specified event object to the signaled state.
member.param: [in] A handle to the event object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.ResetEvent(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sets the specified event object to the nonsignaled state.
member.param: [in] A handle to the event object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysCreateEventW(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a named or an unnamed event object.
member.param: [in] Ignored, must be NULL
[in] Boolean that specifies whether a manual-reset or auto-reset event object is created.
[in] Boolean that specifies the initial state of the event object. If TRUE, the initial state is signaled; otherwise, it is nonsignaled.
[in] Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the event object.
member.returns: A handle to the event object indicates success. If the named event object existed before the function call, the function returns a handle to the existing object and GetLastError returns ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS. NULL indicates failure. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.sysCloseHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.param: [in] Handle to an open object
member.returns: Nonzero indicates success. Zero indicates failure. To get extended error information, call GetLastError

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.GetWindowType
member.summary: Enumeration of values used with sysGetWindow method.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.GetWindowType.First
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window of the same type that is highest in the Z order. If the specified window is a topmost window, the handle identifies the topmost window that is highest in the Z order. If the specified window is a top-level window, the handle identifies the top-level window that is highest in the Z order. If the specified window is a child window, the handle identifies the sibling window that is highest in the Z order.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.GetWindowType.Last
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window of the same type that is lowest in the Z order. If the specified window is a topmost window, the handle identifies the topmost window that is lowest in the Z order. If the specified window is a top-level window, the handle identifies the top-level window that is lowest in the Z order. If the specified window is a child window, the handle identifies the sibling window that is lowest in the Z order.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.GetWindowType.Next
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window below the specified window in the Z order. If the specified window is a topmost window, the handle identifies the topmost window below the specified window. If the specified window is a top-level window, the handle identifies the top-level window below the specified window. If the specified window is a child window, the handle identifies the sibling window below the specified window.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.GetWindowType.Previous
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window above the specified window in the Z order. If the specified window is a topmost window, the handle identifies the topmost window above the specified window. If the specified window is a top-level window, the handle identifies the top-level window above the specified window. If the specified window is a child window, the handle identifies the sibling window above the specified window.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.GetWindowType.Owner
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the specified window's owner window, if any.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.GetWindowType.Child
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the child window at the top of the Z order, if the specified window is a parent window; otherwise, the retrieved handle is NULL. The function examines only child windows of the specified window. It does not examine descendant windows.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.KeyFlags
member.summary: Enumeration of values used with sysKeyBoardEvent method.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.KeyFlags.ExtendedKey
member.summary: If specified, the scan code was preceded by a prefix byte having the value 0xE0 (224).

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.KeyFlags.KeyUp
member.summary: If specified, the key is being released. If not specified, the key is being depressed.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WindowType
member.summary: Enumeration of values used with sysShowWindow method.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WindowType.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WindowType.ShowNormal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WindowType.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WindowType.ShowNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except the window is not activated.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery
member.summary: Enumeration of values used with sysSystemParametersInfoW method.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetAccessTimeout
member.summary: Retrieves information about the time-out period associated with the accessibility features. The pvParam parameter must point to an ACCESSTIMEOUT structure that receives the information.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetFontSmoothing
member.summary: Determines whether the font smoothing feature is enabled. This feature uses font antialiasing to make font curves appear smoother by painting pixels at different gray levels. The pvParam parameter must point to a BOOL variable that receives TRUE if the feature is enabled, or FALSE if it is not.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetHighContrast
member.summary: Retrieves information about the HighContrast accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a HIGHCONTRAST structure that receives the information.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetMouse
member.summary: Retrieves the two mouse threshold values and the mouse acceleration. The pvParam parameter must point to an array of three integers that receives these values.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetMouseKeys
member.summary: Retrieves information about the MouseKeys accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a MOUSEKEYS structure that receives the information.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetScreenSaveTimeout
member.summary: Retrieves the screen saver time-out value, in seconds. The pvParam parameter must point to an integer variable that receives the value.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetShowSounds
member.summary: Determines whether the Show Sounds accessibility flag is on or off. If it is on, the user requires an application to present information visually in situations where it would otherwise present the information only in audible form. The pvParam parameter must point to a BOOL variable that receives TRUE if the feature is on, or FALSE if it is off.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetSoundsEntry
member.summary: Retrieves information about the SoundSentry accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a SOUNDSENTRY structure that receives the information.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetStickyKeys
member.summary: Retrieves information about the StickyKeys accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a STICKYKEYS structure that receives the information.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetToggleKeys
member.summary: Retrieves information about the ToggleKeys accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a TOGGLEKEYS structure that receives the information.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetWheelScrollLines
member.summary: Retrieves the number of lines to scroll when the vertical mouse wheel is moved. The pvParam parameter must point to a UINT variable that receives the number of lines. The default value is 3.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.GetWorkArea
member.summary: Retrieves the size of the work area on the primary display monitor. The work area is the portion of the screen not obscured by the system taskbar or by application desktop toolbars. The pvParam parameter must point to a RECT structure that receives the coordinates of the work area, expressed in virtual screen coordinates.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetAccessTimeout
member.summary: Sets the time-out period associated with the accessibility features. The pvParam parameter must point to an ACCESSTIMEOUT structure that contains the new parameters.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetFontSmoothing
member.summary: Enables or disables the font smoothing feature, which uses font antialiasing to make font curves appear smoother by painting pixels at different gray levels. To enable the feature, set the uiParam parameter to TRUE. To disable the feature, set uiParam to FALSE.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetHighContrast
member.summary: Sets the parameters of the HighContrast accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a HIGHCONTRAST structure that contains the new parameters.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetMouse
member.summary: Sets the two mouse threshold values and the mouse acceleration. The pvParam parameter must point to an array of three integers that specifies these values.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetMouseKeys
member.summary: Sets the parameters of the MouseKeys accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a MOUSEKEYS structure that contains the new parameters.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetScreenSaveTimeout
member.summary: Sets the screen saver time-out value to the value of the uiParam parameter. This value is the amount of time, in seconds, that the system must be idle before the screen saver activates.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetShowSounds
member.summary: Turns the ShowSounds accessibility feature on or off. The uiParam parameter specifies TRUE for on, or FALSE for off.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetSoundsEntry
member.summary: Sets the parameters of the SoundSentry accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a SOUNDSENTRY structure that contains the new parameters.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetStickyKeys
member.summary: Sets the parameters of the StickyKeys accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a STICKYKEYS structure that contains the new parameters.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetToggleKey
member.summary: Sets the parameters of the ToggleKeys accessibility feature. The pvParam parameter must point to a TOGGLEKEYS structure that contains the new parameters.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetWheelScrollLine
member.summary: Sets the number of lines to scroll when the vertical mouse wheel is moved. The number of lines is set from the uiParam parameter.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.SystemQuery.SetWorkArea
member.summary: Sets the size of the work area. The work area is the portion of the screen not obscured by the system taskbar or by application desktop toolbars. The pvParam parameter is a pointer to a RECT structure that specifies the new work area rectangle, expressed in virtual screen coordinates. In a system with multiple display monitors, the function sets the work area of the monitor that contains the specified rectangle.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WinInit
member.summary: Enumeration of values used with sysSystemParametersInfoW method.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WinInit.UpdateIniFile
member.summary: Writes the new system-wide parameter setting to the user profile.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.WinInit.SendChange
member.summary: Broadcasts the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message after updating the user profile.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.AccessType
member.summary: Enumeration of TypeAccess identifiers used with sysCreateFileW method.
member.remarks: Generic, specifies device query access to the object. An application can query device attributes without accessing the device. GenericRead, specifies read access to the object. Data can be read from the file and the file pointer can be moved. Combine with Write for read/write access. GenericWrite, specifies write access to the object. Data can be written to the file and the file pointer can be moved. Combine with Read for read/write access.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.ShareMode
member.summary: Enumeration of ShareMode identifiers used with sysCreateFileW method.
member.remarks: Read indicates that subsequent open operations on the object will succeed only if read access is requested. Write Indicates that subsequent open operations on the object will succeed only if write access is requested.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.ShareMode.Read
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on an object to request read access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the object if they request read access. If this flag is not specified, but the object has been opened for read access, the function fails.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.ShareMode.Write
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on an object to request write access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the object if they request write access. If this flag is not specified, but the object has been opened for write access or has a file mapping with write access, the function fails.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.CreateType
member.summary: Enumeration of CreateType identifiers used with sysCreateFileW method.
member.remarks: CreateNew, creates a new file. The function fails if the specified file already exists. CreateAlways, creates a new file. If the file exists, the function overwrites the file and clears the existing attributes. OpenExisting, Opens the file. The function fails if the file does not exist. For an explanation why you should use the OpenExisting, flag if you are using the CreateFileW function for devices. OpenAlways, opens the file, if it exists. If the file does not exist, the function creates the file as if dwCreationDisposition were CreateNew. TruncateExisting, Opens the file. Once opened, the file is truncated so that its size is zero bytes. The calling process must open the file with at least (AccessType) GenericWrite access. The function fails if the file does not exist.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.CreateType.CreateNew
member.summary: Creates a new file. The function fails if a specified file exists.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.CreateType.CreateAlways
member.summary: Opens a file, always. If a file does not exist, the function creates a file as if dwCreationDisposition is CREATE_NEW.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.CreateType.OpenExisting
member.summary: Opens a file. The function fails if the file does not exist.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.CreateType.OpenAlways
member.summary: Opens a file, always. If a file does not exist, the function creates a file as if dwCreationDisposition is CREATE_NEW.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.CreateType.TruncateExisting
member.summary: Opens a file and truncates it so that its size is zero (0) bytes. The function fails if the file does not exist. The calling process must open the file with the GENERIC_WRITE access right.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.FileAttributes
member.summary: Enumeration of FileAttributes identifiers used with sysCreateFileW method.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.FileAttributes.None
member.summary: No file attributes will be set.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.FileAttributes.WriteThrough
member.summary: Write operations will not go through any intermediate cache, they will go directly to disk. If FILE_FLAG_NO_BUFFERING is not also specified, so that system caching is in effect, then the data is written to the system cache, but is flushed to disk without delay. If FILE_FLAG_NO_BUFFERING is also specified, so that system caching is not in effect, then the data is immediately flushed to disk without going through the system cache. The operating system also requests a write-through the hard disk cache to persistent media. However, not all hardware supports this write-through capability.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.FileAttributes.Overlapped
member.summary: The file is being opened or created for asynchronous I/O. When the operation is complete, the event specified in the OVERLAPPED structure is set to the signaled state. Operations that take a significant amount of time to process return ERROR_IO_PENDING. If this flag is specified, the file can be used for simultaneous read and write operations. The system does not maintain the file pointer, therefore you must pass the file position to the read and write functions in the OVERLAPPED structure or update the file pointer. If this flag is not specified, then I/O operations are serialized, even if the calls to the read and write functions specify an OVERLAPPED structure.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.FileAttributes.NoBuffering
member.summary: The file is being opened with no system caching. This flag does not affect hard disk caching or memory mapped files. When combined with FILE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, the flag gives maximum asynchronous performance, because the I/O does not rely on the synchronous operations of the memory manager. However, some I/O operations take more time, because data is not being held in the cache.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.FileAttributes.RandomAccess
member.summary: The file is to be accessed randomly. The system can use this as a hint to optimize file caching.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.HotkeyModify
member.summary: Enumeration of Hotkey modifiers used with sysRegisterHotKey method.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.HotkeyModify.Alt
member.summary: Either ALT key must be held down.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.HotkeyModify.Control
member.summary: Either CTRL key must be held down.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.HotkeyModify.Shift
member.summary: Either SHIFT key must be held down.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.HotkeyModify.Win
member.summary: Either WINDOWS key was held down. These keys are labeled with the Microsoft Windows logo. Keyboard shortcuts that involve the WINDOWS key are reserved for use by the operating system.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.WinAPI.HotkeyID
member.summary: Enumeration of HotkeyID identifiers used with sysRegisterHotKey method.

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.TaskbarState
member.summary: The TaskbarState class is used to control the state of the taskbar.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.TaskbarState.SetStartMenuState(HSM.Embedded.Utility.TaskbarState.Action,System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Sets the StartMenu state according to the application's Window Z Order.
member.param: Show or Hide
Handle to the application (this.Handle).
Size of the current applications form (this.Size)

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.TaskbarState.SetTaskbarState(HSM.Embedded.Utility.TaskbarState.Action)
member.summary: Sets the taskbar state to either hidden or shown.
member.param: State of the taskbar.

members.member:
Sets the StartMenu state to either hidden or shown.
State of the StartMenu. NOT WORKING YET!!!!!

Sets the SIP Button state to either hidden or shown.
State of the SIP Button. NOT WORKING YET!!!!!

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Utility.TaskbarState.WindowZOrder
member.summary: State of the window's Z Order.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.TaskbarState.WindowZOrder.NotTopMost
member.summary: Places the window in the below the top most Z Order position.

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Utility.TaskbarState.WindowZOrder.TopMost
member.summary: Places the window in the top most Z Order position.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.UtilMethods.GetWindowHandle(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Search for and retrieve handle of window matching parameters.
member.param: Class of window: this will normally be WinAPI.NET_CLASSNAME.
Title of window: normally the Text of the window object.
member.returns: Window handle matching parameters.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Utility.UtilMethods.IsAlreadyRunning(System.String)
member.summary: Check to see if Application with specified name is already running.
member.param: Title of window: normally the Text field of the window object. This call needs to be made before the application starts running. Use caution with this parameter because typically the class associated with the form has not yet been created when this call needs to be made!
member.returns: The running status of the specified application.

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Info.RequestSysInfo(HSM.Embedded.Info.SYS_INFO_ENUM,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: obtain the system information with this funtion.
member.param: [in] SYS_INFO_ENUM, enumeration of request.
[in] Pointer to a buffer that contains the data required to perform the operation. Set to NULL if the sysInfo parameter specifies an operation that does not require input data.
[in] Size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by lpInBuf.
[out] Pointer to a buffer that receives the output data for the operation. Set to NULL if the SYS_INFO_ENUM parameter specifies an operation that does not produce output data nOutBufSize.
Size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by lpOutBuf.
member.returns: return value: 0 for success, else for fail

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Info.RequestDevInfo(HSM.Embedded.Info.DEV_INFO_ENUM,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: obtain the Device information with this funtion.
member.param: [in] DEV_INFO_ENUM, enumeration of request
[in] Pointer to a buffer that contains the data required to perform the operation. Set to NULL if the sysInfo parameter specifies an operation that does not require input data.
[in] Size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by lpInBuf.
[out] Pointer to a buffer that receives the output data for the operation. Set to NULL if the SYS_INFO_ENUM parameter specifies an operation that does not produce output data.
Size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by lpOutBuf.
member.returns: return value: 0 for success, else for fail

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Info.WaitEventSync(HSM.Embedded.Info.SYS_NAMED_EVENT,System.Int32)
member.param: SYS_NAMED_EVENT, enumeration of event.

[in] Specifies the time-out interval, in milliseconds. The function returns if the interval elapses, even if the object's state is nonsignaled. If dwMs is zero, the function tests the object's state and returns immediately. If dwMs is INFINITE, the function's time-out interval never elapses.
member.returns: return value: 0 for success, else for fail

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Info.RegisterEventListener(HSM.Embedded.Info.SYS_NAMED_EVENT,System.Int32,HSM.Embedded.Info.EventCallBack)
member.summary: register a listener to monitor the event asynchronously.
member.param: SYS_NAMED_EVENT, enumeration of event.
[in] Specifies the time-out interval, in milliseconds. It should be greater than 0.
[in] call back function, when event signaled or timeout, it will be called. It cant be NULL.
member.returns: return value: IntPtr.Zero for fail, otherwise success

member.name: M:HSM.Embedded.Info.UnregisterEventListener(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Unregister a listener that monitor the event asynchronously.
member.param: [in] call back function, when event signaled or timeout, it will be called. It cant be NULL.
member.returns: [in] event listener handle, return by RegisterEventListener

member.name: T:HSM.Embedded.Info.SYS_INFO_ENUM
member.summary: System Info enumeration Please refer to "Honeywell Custom IOCTLs and Named Events.doc" for more detail, including return value and platform supported for 6100/6500, please refer to "D6x00_IOCTL_Rev2_13.pdf" sheet

member.name: F:HSM.Embedded.Info.SYS_INFO_ENUM.SYS_GET_WIFI_DATA
member.summary: Pacifico-Supported Type: buffer of 256 bytes The first 2 bytes are for radio type (RADIO_WIFI_HARDWARE_TYPE). The next 6 bytes: 48 bits Mac address If the returned buffer length is greater than 8 bytes then the additional bytes are in free form binary and for additional WiFi information or configuration data.
